Frida Burling, Georgetown's 100-Year-Old Grande Dame, Has Died

Best known to current residents as the Patron Saint of Georgetown House Tours and Patron's Parties, annual events to raise charitable funds for the neighborhood, one-hundred-year-old Frida Frazer Winslow Burling, has died.

2016 Sunset Fitness in the Park

Join the Georgetown Business Improvement District to celebrate summer in Georgetown with, Sunset Fitness in the Park, a free series of outdoor fitness classes.

Searching for 'Meaningful Beauty' at Fifty

I’ve been dreading turning 50. I knew I was scraping rock bottom when I shelled out $131.82 for Cindy Crawford’s “Meaningful Beauty” skin care line after watching an informercial. Yes, an informercial. Somehow, I identified with Cindy because, well, she turned 50 this year.

Stop by Tudor Place on June 18 from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm for a morning of mimosas and nostalgic games.

The Watergate Hotel Reopens in June

The 1967 Luigi Moretti-designed hotel complex, made famous by the 1972 break-in of then headquarters of the Democratic National Committee located on its sixth floor, will once again open its doors in June following an extensive $125 million renovation.

Katherine's Diet Tip #7: Visit Old McDonald!

Old McDonald Had a Farm ... I'll never forget those tomatoes. They were soft, plump, sweet and deep red, still warm from the sun - the kind you only get fresh from the vine. And for us city folks, the kind we usually can only get at our local Farmers Markets.

Stunning Georgetown East Village Town Home

A beautifully renovated four-level Federal town home in Georgetown’s East Village has been listed by Washington Fine Properties for $2,899,000.

Observance!

Christopher Hooton is a policy wonk turned sci-fi writer. How does that happen? “I had always liked writing from when I was a kid and in high school. I actually wrote my first book when I was 21 in undergrad,” he told Hollywood on the Potomac.

Lilly Pulitzer Opens in Georgetown

"Life is a party. Dress Like it!" Lilly Pulitzer

American socialite and iconic fashion designer's Palm Beach-inspired line of colorful, floral printed resort wear and accessories is coming to Georgetown.

Discover Umbrian Wines Class & Dinner May 26th

Come to Via Umbria on May 26th for an evening all about wine.

Discover a selection of wines from Umbria and learn about their flavors and the wine making process from our experts.

Please Vote DC Democratic Caucus, May 21st

The DC State Democratic Party holds its caucus on Saturday, May 21st from 10am to 2pm at the DC Convention Center to select delegates to the Convention. My name will appear on the ballot to become a pledged delegate for Hillary Rodham Clinton.

The Brits

We’re not sure what our friends across the pond think of our politicians or the Presidential campaign process, but we love the Brits….particularly the rowdy bunch in Parliament … and figured they could pass along some tips.

Georgetown Farmers Market Launches June 5

Beginning June 5, Licking Creek Bend Farm will host a Georgetown Farmers Market every Sunday from 10:00 am - 2:00 pm at the corner of Wisconsin and P Street.

See How Bees Do It at Dumbarton House

Dumbarton House presents From Hives to Honey: A Tasting with Bee America on Saturday, May 21 from 12:00 - 2 :00 pm.

Signal Timing Adjustments Coming to M Street Soon

By Brady HoltCurrent Staff Writer

Traffic signals on M Street NW in Georgetown may soon be re-timed so pedestrians don’t have to wait as long to cross, according to the D.C. Department of Transportation.

Eroding Public Trust in D.C. Government

The D.C. Children & Youth Investment Trust Corporation (CYITC) was formed in June 1999 as an independent 501(c)(3) organization to link public and private resources committed to addressing the long-term needs of children, youth and their families in the District of Columbia.

The Phillips Collection is hosting an exhibition of paintings by William Merritt Chase (American, 1849–1916) from June 4 through September 11, 2016.

CARE Speakers Reach For Compassion

Former U.S. Secretary of State Madeleine K. Alright delivered an impassioned talk to CARE’s 2016 National Conference Monday night on the importance of aiding displaced people around the world.

By Mark LiebermanCurrent Staff Writer

The Latham Hotel site in Georgetown is now slated to be restored as a new hotel, instead of the residential project that a previous developer won approval for a few years ago.

Katherine's Diet Tip #4: Don't Cook on Weekdays + Addictive Asparagus Recipe

Strange advice? Well, I mean it. Life is busy, busy, busy, and if you try to do your weekday cooking on top of everything else, you'll find yourself making reservations at every joint in town.

Promise Night Takes Center Stage

Basketball great and Hall of Framer Earvin “Magic” Johnson, in accepting a Promise of America award at Howard Theater Wednesday night, marveled that he was in the company of Mrs. Alma Powell, who herself has gathered so many honors.
